result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Craig Daly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count 2; with credit for 108 days time served

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at $0.00.

- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with any Speedway Gas Station and Festival Foods in Milwaukee County and NO CONTACT with victim N.D.G.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count 1; with credit for 108 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Craig Daly

records.addlTxt:
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 2, with credit for 108 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 1, with credit for 108 days time served.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers. 
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
- NO CONTACT with any Speedway Gas Station and Festival Foods in Milwaukee County and NO CONTACT with victim N.D.G.

Court set restitution at $0.00.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Justin Craig Daly appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Justin Craig Daly.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  State filed Amended Information.  Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Information, waives formal reading, and temporarily pleads not guilty on behalf of Mr. Daly. 

Parties have reached an agreement.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin Craig Daly
Current: 2205 South 22nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: Homeless, West Allis, WI 53214
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Justin Craig Daly appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Justin Craig Daly.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Cash bail is reduced to $500. All previously ordered conditions, including the no contact orders remain in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail.

Defendant Justin Craig Daly in court by video with attorney Theodore OReilly appears in person.  Defendant Justin Craig Daly in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective L. Binter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:13 AM Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Justin Craig Daly not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant refused to appear for Court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with NDG, Speedway
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Justin Craig Daly in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Justin Craig Daly in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
